title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: When King David I. laid the foundations of Melrose Abbey, the ground on which Melrose now stands was occupied by a village called Fordel.

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: It was driven by water that came from the direction of Fordel.

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: The two boys mentioned lived a little in the direction of Fordel, and were i:)retty-well known there.

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: One day I arranged for an expedition  to Fordel with the two boys in whose company I found my way into the school porch (p. 37), to get bark to make bird-lime, which I think was the only really lawless adventure  I engaged in.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: Among them are the portraits by Raeburn ofGeorge Chalmers of Pittencrieff and Provost Low of Fordel,one by Sir Francis Grant of James 8th Earl of Elgin,who was successively Governor-General of Jamaica, Canada,and India, and Plenipotentiary to China; and a fourthportrait by Lawrence of Admiral Sir Andrew Mitchell.
